INRD PILOT OPERATED TRAIN ON INRD TRACK FROM INRD MP-Y.4.5 AND REACHED SPEED OF 11 MPH WHEN DERAILMENT OCCURRED.  SEVENTH THROUGH TENTH CARS DERAILED OFWHICH THREE CARS TIPPED RESULTING IN SPILL OF COAL.  ONE DERAILED CAR IMPACTED A VEHICLE WHICH WASPARKED NEAR TRACKS.    CAUSE WAS DETERMINED TO BE POOR RAIL AND TIE CONDITION ON INRD TRACK.  INSPECTION FOUND UNEVEN RAIL DUE TO MUD UNDER TIES.  SPILLED COAL ALONG THE RIGHT-OF-WAY INDICATED CONSIDERABLE ROCKING BEFORE DERAILMENT.   INRD RAILROAD ADVISED THEY INCURRED $8,302 TO THEIR TRACK AND EQUIPMENT IS ESTIMATED AT $90,000.   INRD PILOT ENGINEER BEGAN HIS HOURS-OF-SERVICE AT 1300 FOR A TOTALOF 3HRS. 38 MIN. ON DUTY AT TIME OF INCIDENT.

179818-d-06-12-03-SOO.Primary Accident Cause: Other wheel defects (CAR) (Provide detailed description in  narrative)
179818-d-06-12-03-SOO.Accident Cause: Other wheel defects (CAR) (Provide detailed description in  narrative)
179818-d-06-12-03-SOO.Narrative: TRAIN 583-11, TRAVELING WEST WAS YARDING THEIR TRAIN ON 16 TRACK.  ON THE FOURTH CAR FROM THE REAR OF THE TRAIN (NKCR 1269 A 3 PAK) IT APPEARS THAT THE LEAD WHEEL ON THE NORTH SIDE OF THE SECOND TRUCKCLIMBED THE RAIL AT THE 16 / 17 SWITCH. 94 INCHES FROM THE SWITCH POINT THE LEAD WHEEL ON THE SOUTHSIDE DERAILS. 36 INCHES LATER IT RERAILS ON 17 TRACK. AS THE MOVEMENT CONTINUES WESTWARD THE TRAILING WHEELS ON THE SECOND TRUCK DERAILED AND CONTINUED DOWN 17 TRACK WITH THE NORTH WHEEL ON THE INSIDE OF THE NORTH RAIL AND THE SOUTH WHEEL ON THE OUTSIDE OF THE SOUTH RAIL.  CAR CONTINUES APPROXIMATELY 800 FEET UNTIL THE DISTANCE BETWEEN 16 AND 17 TRACK BEGINS TO INCREASE. UP TO THIS POINT THE NORTH RAIL ON 16 TRACK IS BEING ROLLED OVER. THE LEAD WHEELS ON THE SECOND TRUCK ARE NOW PULLED TO THE SOUTH CAUSING SEVENTEEN TRACK TO SHIFT TO THE SOUTH TWO TO THREE FEET. THE NKCR 1269 CONTACTS THE CONCRETE ABUTEMENT OF THE 16 STREET VIADUCT CAUSING THE SOUTH RAIL OF 16 TRACK TO ROLL OVER AND PULL THE SOUTH WHEELS, OF THE TRAILING TRUCK, OF BRAN 7300. THIS CAR IS TO WEST OF NKCR 1269. THE THREE CARS TO THE EAST OF NKCR 1269  DERAILED DUE TO RAIL ROLL OVER.   CAUSE: VERTICAL WEAR WITH ROLLOVER ONWHEELSET NKCR 1269

03062501-d-06-25-03-NYSW.Reporting Railroad Name: New York, Susquehanna & Western Railroad Company
03062501-d-06-25-03-NYSW.Narrative:
SU100 ROAD TRAIN BETWEEN BINGHAMTON,NY AND LITTLE FERY NJ DERAILED AT MILLRIFT PA, ENGINEER DID NOTNOTICE ANYTHING WRONG WITH TRACK AS THEY WERE GOING OVER POD, RAIL KINKED UNDER TRAIN, 93 DEGREES SUNNY, HAD NOT BEEN THAT WARM IN THIS AREA YET, DERAILED CARS # 18, 38,41, AND 43.  CARS THAT HAD DERAILED WERE ALL LONG CARS.
THE REST OF THE CARS MADE IT OVER KINK WITHOUT DERAILING.  1ST CAR DERAILED WENT 2500 FT FROM POD THEN OVER DELAWARE RIVER BRIGE BEFORE TRAIN CAME TO A REST WITH THE 1ST CARDERAILED STILL UPRIGHT.
03062501-d-06-25-03-NYSW.Reporting Parent Railroad Company Name: New York, Susquehanna & Western Railroad Company

I1003-d-06-23-03-PATH.Primary Accident Cause: Flagging, improper or failure to flag
I1003-d-06-23-03-PATH.Accident Cause: Flagging, improper or failure to flag
I1003-d-06-23-03-PATH.Narrative: THE YARD SWITCHMAN WAS INSTRUCTED TO MAKE A MOVE FROM TRACK 5 TO TRACK 6 INSIDE THE SHOP ON THE EASTEND.  WHILE MAKING THE MOVE, THE CONSIST STRUCK THE DOOR ON THE WEST END OF TRACK 6 LEADING OUT OFTHE BUILDING.  SWITCHMAN 1 WAS OPERATING FROM CAR 812, AND SWITCHMAN 2 WAS FLAGGING FROM THE LOCOMOTIVE.  THE CARS IN CONSIST WERE 812-854-628-841-691-735-868-802-753-700-634-765W-F22-L1.  BOTH SWITCHMEN IN THEIR REPORTS STATE THE CAUSE TO BE LOSS OF COMMUNICATION.  FURTHER INVESTIGATION OF THE INCIDENT DETERMINED THE RADIO IN THE LOCOMOTIVE TO BE INOPERATIVE PRIOR TO MOVING THE EQUIPMENT.  BUZZERAND INTERCOM WOULD NOT HAVE WORKED AS AN ALTERNATE MEANS OF COMMUNICATION, BECAUSE ONE OF THE CONSISTS WAS A WORK FLAT.  BRAKE TEST WAS PERFORMED AND FOUND TO BE OPERATING PROPERLY.  THE PRIMARY CAUSE OF THE INCIDENT WAS FAILURE TO PROPERLY FLAG BY THE SWITCHMAN. BOTH SWITCHMEN WERE SENT FOR DRUG AND ALCOHOL TESTING AFTER THE INCIDENT.  ALL RESULTS WERE NEGATIVE.  TOTAL DAMAGE TO EQUIPMENT AND DOOR IS ESTIMATED TO BE $25,100.
